drawing him down put her arm round his thin, scraggy neck. 
"Father," she said, "do not turn away from me, let us weep together." 
i8o 
"Scoundrels! Blackguards 1" shrieked the old man, turning his face away from her. "Destroy- ing the army, destroying the men! And why? Go, go and tell Lise." 
The princess sank helplessly into an arm- chair beside her father and wept. She saw her brother now as he had been at the moment when he took leave of her and of Lise, his look tender yet proud. She saw
